definitions.definition: having the power to move heavy weights or perform other physically demanding tasks.
examples: she cut through the water with her strong arms
synonyms: husky; datedstalwart "Ben is a strong lad"

definitions.definition: able to perform a specified action well and powerfully.
examples: he was not a strong swimmer

definitions.definition: exerting great force.
(of an argument or case) likely to succeed because of sound reasoning or convincing evidence.
examples: there is a strong argument for decentralization

definitions.definition: possessing skills and qualities that create a likelihood of success.
powerfully affecting the mind, senses, or emotions.
examples: his imagery made a strong impression on the critics

definitions.definition: used after a number to indicate the size of a group.
examples: a hostile crowd several thousand strong

definitions.definition: able to withstand great force or pressure.
examples: cotton is strong, hard-wearing, and easy to handle

definitions.definition: (of a person's constitution) not easily affected by disease or hardship.
not easily disturbed, upset, or affected.
examples: driving on these highways requires strong nerves

definitions.definition: (of a person's character) showing determination, self-control, and good judgment.
examples: only a strong will enabled him to survive

definitions.definition: (of a market) having steadily high or rising prices.
firmly held or established.
synonyms: fervent More"a strong interest in literature"keen

definitions.definition: (of light) very intense.
examples: intense, deep, rich, bright, brilliant, vivid More"a strong blue color"bright, brilliant, dazzling, glaring "strong lights"Morea strong blue colorbright, brilliant, dazzling, glaring strong lights

definitions.definition: (of something seen or heard) not soft or muted; clear or prominent.
(of food or its flavor) distinctive and pungent.
(of a solution or drink) containing a large proportion of a particular substance; concentrated.
(of language or actions) forceful and extreme, especially excessively or unacceptably so.
examples: the government was urged to take strong measures against the perpetrators of violence

definitions.definition: (of an acid or base) fully ionized into cations and anions in solution; having (respectively) a very low or a very high pH.

denoting a class of verbs in Germanic languages that form the past tense and past participle by a change of vowel within the stem rather than by addition of a suffix (e.g., swim, swam, swum ); contrasted with weak.

of, relating to, or denoting the strongest of the known kinds of force between particles, which acts between nucleons and other hadrons when closer than about 10−13 cm (so binding protons in a nucleus despite the repulsion due to their charge), and which conserves strangeness, parity, and isospin.
